summary: Creates a new text file named 'output.txt' and writes the string 'Hello, World!' to it.
Reads a text file named 'input.txt' line by line and prints each line to the console.
Opens an existing file named 'log.txt' and appends a new line of text to the end of it.
Checks if a file named 'config.ini' exists in the current directory and prints a message accordingly.
Attempts to delete a file named 'temp.dat' and reports success or failure.
Renames a file from 'oldname.txt' to 'newname.txt'.
Copies the contents of 'source.bin' to 'dest.bin' using a binary buffer copy.
Opens a binary file and calculates its size in bytes.
Creates a new directory named 'NewFolder' in the current path.
Removes an empty directory named 'OldFolder'.
Reads and displays only the first line of the file 'readme.txt'.
Counts the total number of lines in 'document.txt' by iterating through the file.
Lists all files with the '.txt' extension in the current directory.
Retrieves and prints the current working directory path.
Changes the current working directory to 'C:Temp'.
Extracts and prints the file extension from the filename 'image.jpg'.
Extracts the filename 'report.pdf' from a full file path.
Uses TStringList to load an entire text file into memory and print its content.
Creates a TStringList, adds two lines of text, and saves it to 'output.txt'.
Retrieves the last modification date and time of 'script.pas' and prints it.
Reads a CSV file and prints each row to the console.
Splits a comma-separated string into individual components using TStringList.
Creates a binary file 'numbers.dat' and writes integers 1 through 5 to it.
Reads integers from a binary file 'numbers.dat' and prints them to the console.
Reads 'lower.txt', converts contents to uppercase, and writes to 'upper.txt'.
Counts the total number of characters in 'text.txt' by reading character by character.
Reads the third line (index 2) of 'list.txt' using a StringList.
Checks if 'secret.txt' has the hidden attribute set.
Creates an empty file named 'new.txt' only if it does not already exist.
Searches for the substring 'target' within 'search.txt' and prints if it was found.
Concatenates the contents of 'part1.txt' and 'part2.txt' into 'full.txt'.
Reads and prints the last line of 'log.txt'.
Clears the contents of 'clear.txt' by reopening it with Rewrite.
Generates a random temporary file path in the system's temporary directory.
Executes the system command 'ls -l' and prints the output (Free Pascal).
Replaces all occurrences of 'foo' with 'bar' in 'doc.txt'.
Prints the available free space on the current drive in Megabytes.
Reads an integer value from the first line of 'config.txt'.
Copies a file using TFileStream for efficient binary copying.
Checks if the directory 'C:Windows' exists.
Reads a line of text from standard input (keyboard) and echoes it back.
Writes a message explicitly to the Standard Output stream.
Writes a message explicitly to the Standard Error stream.
Retrieves and prints the value of the 'PATH' environment variable.
Iterates through and prints all command-line arguments passed to the program.
Terminates the program immediately with an exit code of 1.
Generates 10 random numbers (0-99) and writes them to 'random.txt'.
Measures the time taken to execute a Sleep command and prints the elapsed time.
Reads 'chars.txt' character by character and prints only the digits found.
Performs a binary search for the value 50 in a sorted binary file 'sorted.dat'.
Calculates the factorial of a number using a recursive function.
Reverses a string by iterating backwards and constructing a new string.
Determines if a given integer is a prime number.
Sorts an array of integers using the Bubble Sort algorithm.
Checks if a string is a palindrome (reads the same forwards and backwards).
Computes the Nth Fibonacci number using recursion.
Demonstrates the declaration, sizing, and usage of a dynamic array.
Defines a record type 'TPerson' and demonstrates setting and reading its fields.
Demonstrates basic pointer usage, including referencing and dereferencing variables.
Calculates the Greatest Common Divisor (GCD) of two numbers using the Euclidean algorithm.

code:
program ParamStrCheck;
begin
  if ParamCount > 0 then
    Writeln('First param: ', ParamStr(1))
  else
    Writeln('No params');
end.
